title: Modeling a Periodic Context - Electric Fan Part B

content.question: Part B The function \(h\) can be written in the form <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>h</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>sin</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>b</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>c</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><mi>d</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4804@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Find values of constants \(a\), \(b\), \(c\), and \(d\).

frqParts.text: Part B The function \(h\) can be written in the form <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>h</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>sin</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>b</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>c</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><mi>d</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4804@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Find values of constants \(a\), \(b\), \(c\), and \(d\).

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Construct new functions, using transformations, compositions, inverses, or regressions, that may be useful in modeling contexts, criteria, or data, with and without technology.
